main_definition: To say something exactly as it happens or in a precise manner without exaggeration, metaphor, or hyperbole.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to emphasize that what is being said should not be taken figuratively but understood exactly and factually
meanings_and_examples.example: She was literally covered in snow after the blizzard.

meanings_and_examples.definition: When used ironically or sarcastically, it suggests a humorous exaggeration of an unrealistic situation
meanings_and_examples.example: He said he had been walking for literal days without food or water!

meanings_and_examples.definition: In some cases, this term can be misused to overemphasize something that is actually hyperbolic in nature
meanings_and_examples.example: The building was so tall, it looked like a tiny ant standing next to it.
